etymologies: late 15th century (in the sense ‘characteristic of a man’): from French viril or Latin virilis, from vir ‘man’

definitions: having strength, energy, and a strong sex drive (typically used of a man)

examples.text: he was a powerful, virile man

shortDefinitions: having strength, energy, and strong sex drive

definitions: having or characterized by strength and energy

examples.text: a strong, virile performance of the Mass

shortDefinitions: having or characterized by strength and energy
